abstract:
The Environmental Assessment Program (EAP) outlines a Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) for collecting and analyzing conductivity samples in freshwater environments. This method is crucial for monitoring water quality in streams, particularly for Total Maximum Daily Load studies and other specialized projects.

The SOP includes procedures for meter calibration, sample collection, measurement, and quality assurance/quality control. These steps ensure accurate measurements of conductivity levels using the Direct In-Situ Method. The method aligns with the standards set in APHA's Standard Methods 2510 B (APHA, 2005).

This process is essential for addressing potential water quality issues and maintaining compliance with environmental regulations. Since marine waters require different measurement techniques, this SOP is exclusively designed for freshwater monitoring.

description:
This document outlines the Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) for the Environmental Assessment Program's (EAP) Freshwater Monitoring Unit's (FMU) conductivity sampling method as per the Environmental Monitoring and Trends Section. The SOP incorporates the Direct In-Situ Method (DISM), which is used in wadeable streams for Total Maximum Daily Load (TMDL) studies and other specialized investigations.

The procedures outlined in this SOP pertain to meter calibration, sample collection, measurement of conductivity samples, and quality assurance/quality control (QA/QC). The calibration of the conductivity meter is performed using reference standards following established protocols to ensure accuracy and precision.

Sample collection entails following specific procedures to minimize contamination during fieldwork. Samples are collected using approved containers and preserved according to standard methods as necessary. Care is taken to ensure that samples are representative of the monitored water body.

The conductivity measurements for the samples are carried out using methods in accordance with Standard Methods 2510B (APHA, 2005). These procedures encompass various steps such as rinsing and conditioning the electrodes prior to measurement, ensuring proper temperature compensation, and recording the data accurately.

It is important to note that for marine waters measurements or samples, different methods and quality assurance plans should be followed as specified in separate documentation. This SOP is specifically intended for freshwater monitoring applications.
